metadata.title: CVE-2020-35533 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In LibRaw, an out-of-bounds read vulnerability exists within the"LibRaw::adobe_copy_pixel()" function (libraw\src\decoders\dng.cpp) whenreading data from the image file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.19.5-1ubuntu1.1
libraw19 - 0.19.5-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

digikam - 4:6.4.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
digikam-data - 4:6.4.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
digikam-private-libs - 4:6.4.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
showfoto - 4:6.4.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libraw package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.19.5-1ubuntu1.1').
darktable package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
rawtherapee package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
kodi package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
digikam package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:6.4.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm1').
